glosses: In a state of breathlessness, while out of breath, short-winded.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish صولوغی صولوغنه (ṣoluġu ṣoluġuna), from صولوق (ṣoluḳ), equivalent to soluk (“breath, an instance of breathing”) + -u (possessive suffix) + soluk + -u (possessive suffix) + -(n)a (dative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant).
